page.title: 04HOUSING IN LT.GADDESDEN AREA
page.content: There are 21 bungalows in Bede Court specialy built for old people with a warden to watch over them. There are other semi-detached 3-bedroom Council houses in other parts of the village. Along the green and in the woods are houses once belonging to the Ashridge Estate. Many have a stone showing the coat of arms of Lord Brownlow. Red bricks are mainly used on the old houses and lighter coloured ones on new. There are very large houses, especially in the secluded parts, with tennis courts etc. Many houses have had extensions and house prices have rocketed 1000% in the past 50 years. Local youngsters cannot afford to buy a dwelling here. Farmhouses look prosperous and the whole area has a well-kept appearance.
